channel.title: GeekSpeak
channel.itunes:subtitle: Bridging the gap between Geeks and the rest of humanity.
channel.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell
channel.description: A weekly talk show about technology, science, and human creativity that excites, educates, and fosters curiosity. Discussions touch upon how technology affects society and how we react to that change. Hosts are passionate about explaining complex concepts in simple, easy to digest, explanations allowing everyone to understand. We bridge the gaps between Geeks and the rest of humanity.
channel.itunes:summary: A weekly talk show about technology, science, and human creativity that excites, educates, and fosters curiosity. Discussions touch upon how technology affects society and how we react to that change. Hosts are passionate about explaining complex concepts in simple, easy to digest, explanations allowing everyone to understand. We bridge the gaps between Geeks and the rest of humanity.
channel.copyright: Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 United States License

item.title: Perl’s First Stage of Net Neutrality is Swift 2016/01/02
item.description:
A successful SpaceX flight, Swift and Perl, mobile carriers and net neutrality issues. Disney using DMCA against individual’s photo of a Star Wars figurine.

And we round up the show with talk of Star Wars VII (at the end with warning).
item.itunes:subtitle: Lyle Troxell, Brian Young, and Miles Elam
item.itunes:summary: A successful SpaceX flight, Swift and Perl, mobile carriers and net neutrality issues. Disney using DMCA against individual's photo of a Star Wars figurine. And we round up the show with talk of Star Wars VII (at the end with warning).
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell

item.title: Transforming Human Perception with Kara Platoni 2015/12/26
item.description: A long form conversation with science journalist and lecturer Kara Platoni about her new book: We Have the Technology: How Biohackers, Foodies, Physicians, & Scientists Are Transforming Human Perception One Sense at a Time.
item.itunes:summary: A long form conversation with science journalist and lecturer Kara Platoni about her new book: We Have the Technology: How Biohackers, Foodies, Physicians, & Scientists Are Transforming Human Perception One Sense at a Time.

item.title: Big Solar Sends Kids to the AI Mine 2015/12/19
item.description: A town in North Carolina says no to solar power, There’s a new game in town when it comes to Artificial Intelligence, and the EFF brings light to the side effects of outsourcing public school IT services to companies like Google.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lyle Troxell, Brian Young, and Miles Elam
item.itunes:summary: A town in North Carolina says no to solar power, There’s a new game in town when it comes to Artificial Intelligence, and the EFF brings light to the side effects of outsourcing public school IT services to companies like Google.
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell

item.title: Interview Kepler on Jury Rigging 2015/12/12
item.description:
It’s “Jury Rig”, use PEX, software development expertise is useful for software development, use three words for any spot on the planet.

And in the second half: Aline Lerner, founder of interviewing.io, shares her insight about the uselessness of a resume when matching a person to a tech job: there is a better way.
item.itunes:summary: It's "Jury Rig", use PEX, software development expertise is useful for software development, use three words for any spot on the planet. And in the second half: Aline Lerner, founder of interviewing.io, shares her insight about the uselessness of a resume when matching a person to a tech job: there is a better way.

item.title: Can't Fix Black Friday, Figure It Out 2015/12/05
item.description: On Black Friday the Geeks fixed things, and urge you to do the same. You can figure things out, enjoy the learning, and learn to solve problems. Lyle and Ben chat about not knowing and still figuring things out.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lyle Troxell and Ben Jaffe
item.itunes:summary: On Black Friday the Geeks fixed things, and urge you to do the same. You can figure things out, enjoy the learning, and learn to solve problems. Lyle and Ben chat about not knowing and still figuring things out.
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell

item.title: Geeks State "To the Moon, iPad Pro" 2015/11/28
item.description: External features of the world effect us internally, why does the moon have more creators on the “dark side”, our thoughts on the iPad Pro, and a bit about bridges.
item.itunes:subtitle: Brian Young, Ben Jaffe, and Lyle Troxell
item.itunes:summary: External features of the world effect us internally, why does the moon have more creators on the "dark side", our thoughts on the iPad Pro, and a bit about bridges.
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell

item.title: Mobile Ranging Computational Cinematographer 2015/11/21
item.description: A conversation with Arnav Jhala about computational cinematography and story comprehension, a chat about developing the MobileRanger App, and a quick review of the AppleTV.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lyle Troxell
item.itunes:summary: A conversation with Arnav Jhala about computational cinematography and story comprehension, a chat about developing the MobileRanger App, and a quick review of the AppleTV.
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell

item.title: Vader Statue Pwns HTTPS 2015/11/14
item.description: Lenin looses to Vader, make sure you buy the right USB-C cable, caffeinated peanut butter, and a long form discussion on trust with regards to computers, password managers, and SSL certificates.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lyle Troxell, Brian Young, and Miles Elam
item.itunes:summary: Lenin looses to Vader, make sure you buy the right USB-C cable, caffeinated peanut butter, and a long form discussion on trust with regards to computers, password managers, and SSL certificates.
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell

item.title: Coin Card Senses Internet of Things’ Vulnerabilities 2015/11/07
item.description: Is the Internet of things a good thing? How do your senses affect each other? What’s the new thing in card payments?
item.itunes:subtitle: Lyle Troxell, Bonnie Jean Primbsch, Ben Jaffe, and Brian Young
item.itunes:summary: Is the Internet of things a good thing? How do your senses affect each other? What’s the new thing in card payments?
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell

item.title: Life, Memory, and the art of Phoning it in 2015/10/31
item.description: New evidence for life beginning out there, not here. The epoch of fast computer storage will change what you can do. Wifi calling is here and it is awesome. The Geeks do a long form show.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lyle Troxell, Brian Young, Miles Elam, and Ben Jaffe
item.itunes:summary: New evidence for life beginning out there, not here. The epoch of fast computer storage will change what you can do. Wifi calling is here and it is awesome. The Geeks do a long form show.
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell
